Name: ImmunizationFunctionCodes
Title: Immunization Function Codes
Descriptino: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the function a practitioner or organization may play in the immunization event. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

Name: ImmunizationFundingSource
Title: Immunization Funding Source
Descriptino: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the source of the vaccine administered. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

Name: ImmunizationOriginCodes
Title: Immunization Origin Codes
Descriptino: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the source of the data when the report of the immunization event is not based on information from the person, entity or organization who administered the vaccine. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

Name: ImmunizationProgramEligibility
Title: Immunization Program Eligibility
Descriptino: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the patient's eligibility for a vaccination program. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

Name: ImmunizationReasonCodes
Title: Immunization Reason Codes
Descriptino: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the reason why a dose of vaccine was administered. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

Name: ImmunizationRouteCodes
Title: Immunization Route Codes
Descriptino: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the administrative routes used during vaccination. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

Name: CodesForImmunizationSiteOfAdministration
Title: Codes for Immunization Site of Administration
Descriptino: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the body site where the vaccination occurred. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

Name: ImmunizationStatusCodes
Title: Immunization Status Codes
Descriptino: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the current status of the administered dose of vaccine.

Name: ImmunizationStatusReasonCodes
Title: Immunization Status Reason Codes
Descriptino: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the reason why a dose of vaccine was not administered. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

Name: ImmunizationSubpotentReason
Title: Immunization Subpotent Reason
Descriptino: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

Name: ImmunizationTargetDiseaseCodes
Title: Immunization Target Disease Codes
Descriptino: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the disease that the dose is being administered against. This value set is provided as a suggestive example and includes the SNOMED CT concepts from the 64572001 (Disease) hierarchy.

Name: LOINCCodes

Name: ObservationInterpretationCodes
Title: Observation Interpretation Codes
Descriptino: A categorical assessment, providing a rough qualitative interpretation of the observation value,    such as “normal”/ “abnormal”,”low” / “high”, “better” / “worse”, “susceptible” / “resistant”, “expected”/ “not expected”.    The value set is intended to be for ANY use where coded representation of an interpretation is needed.             Notes:          This is being communicated in v2.x in OBX-8 (Observation Interpretation), in v3 in ObservationInterpretation (CWE) in R1 (Representative Realm) and in FHIR in    Observation.interpretation. Historically these values come from the laboratory domain, and these codes are extensively    used. The value set binding is extensible, so codes outside the value set that are needed for interpretation concepts    (i.e. particular meanings) that are not included in the value set can be used, and these new codes may also be added to    the value set and published in a future version.

Name: ObservationMethods
Title: Observation Methods
Descriptino: Observation Method codes from [SNOMED CT](http://snomed.info/sct) where concept is-a 272394005 (Technique (qualifier value)) or is-a 129264002 (Action (qualifier value)) or is-a 386053000 (Evaluation procedure(procedure))

Name: ObservationStatus
Title: ObservationStatus
Descriptino: Codes providing the status of an observation.

Name: ParticipantRoles
Title: Participant Roles
Descriptino: Roles of participants that may be included in a care team.  Defined as: Is a Person, Healthcare professional (occupation) or Healthcare related organization (qualifier value).

Name: PatientContactRelationship

Descriptino: The nature of the relationship between the patient and the contact person.

Name: ProcedurePerformerRoleCodes

Name: ProcedureCategoryCodes(SNOMEDCT)

Name: ProcedureFollowUpCodes(SNOMEDCT)

Name: ProcedureNotPerformedReason(SNOMED-CT)
Title: Procedure Not Performed Reason (SNOMED-CT)
Descriptino: Situation codes describing the reason that a procedure, which might otherwise be expected, was not performed, or a procedure that was started and was not completed. Consists of SNOMED CT codes, children of procedure contraindicated (183932001), procedure discontinued (416406003), procedure not done (416237000), procedure not indicated (428119001), procedure not offered (416064006), procedure not wanted (416432009), procedure refused (183944003), and procedure stopped (394908001).

Name: ProcedureOutcomeCodes(SNOMEDCT)

Descriptino: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

Name: ServiceRequestCategoryCodes
Title: Service Request Category Codes

Name: ServiceRequestOrderDetailsCodes
Title: Service Request Order Details Codes
Descriptino: An example value set of Codified order entry details concepts.  These concepts only make sense in the context of what is being ordered.  This example is for a patient ventilation order

Title: SubscriberPolicyholder Relationship Codes
Descriptino: This value set includes codes for the relationship between the Subscriber and the Beneficiary (insured/covered party/patient).

Name: SubstanceCode
Title: Substance Code
Descriptino: This value set contains concept codes for specific substances. It includes codes from [SNOMED](http://snomed.info/sct) where concept is-a 105590001 (Substance (substance)) and where concept is-a 373873005 (Pharmaceutical / biologic product (product))

Name: VaccineAdministeredValueSet
Title: Vaccine Administered Value Set
Descriptino: This identifies the vaccine substance administered - CVX codes.

Name: DetailedEthnicity
Title: Detailed ethnicity
Descriptino: The codes for the concepts 'Unknown', 'Asked but no answer', 'other, and the 41 [CDC ethnicity codes](http://www.cdc.gov/phin/resources/vocabulary/index.html) that are grouped under one of the 2 OMB ethnicity category codes.

Name: DetailedRace
Title: Detailed Race
Descriptino: The codes for the concepts 'Unknown', 'Asked but no answer', 'other, and the 900+ [CDC Race codes](http://www.cdc.gov/phin/resources/vocabulary/index.html) that are grouped under one of the 5 OMB race category codes.

Name: OmbEthnicityCategories
Title: OMB Ethnicity Categories
Descriptino: The codes for the concepts 'Unknown', 'Asked but no answer', and the ethnicity categories - 'Hispanic or Latino' and 'Not Hispanic or Latino' - as defined by the [OMB Standards for Maintaining, Collecting, and Presenting Federal Data on Race and Ethnicity, Statistical Policy Directive No. 15, as revised, October 30, 1997](https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/FR-1997-10-30/pdf/97-28653.pdf).

Name: OmbRaceCategories
Title: OMB Race Categories
Descriptino: The codes for the concepts 'Unknown', 'Asked but Unknown', 'Other Race'* and the codes for the five race categories - 'American Indian' or 'Alaska Native', 'Asian', 'Black or African American', 'Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander', and 'White' - as defined by the [OMB Standards for Maintaining, Collecting, and Presenting Federal Data on Race and Ethnicity, Statistical Policy Directive No. 15, as revised, October 30, 1997](https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/FR-1997-10-30/pdf/97-28653.pdf)  \* The use of 'Other Race' is discouraged for statistical analysis.

Name: LanguageCodesWithLanguageAndOptionallyARegionModifier
Title: Language codes with language and optionally a region modifier
Descriptino: This value set includes codes from [BCP-47](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). This value set matches the ONC 2015 Edition LanguageCommunication data element value set within C-CDA to use a 2 character language code if one exists,   and a 3 character code if a 2 character code does not exist. It points back to [RFC 5646](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5646), however only the language codes are required, all other elements are optional.

Name: USCoreClinicalResultObservationCategory
Title: US Core Clinical Result Observation Category
Descriptino: Used to classify the context of clinical result observations.

Name: USCoreConditionCodes
Title: US Core Condition Codes
Descriptino: This describes the problem. Diagnosis/Problem List is broadly defined as a series of brief statements that catalog a patient's medical, nursing, dental, social, preventative and psychiatric events and issues that are relevant to that patient's healthcare (e.g., signs, symptoms, and defined conditions). ICD-10 is appropriate for Diagnosis information, and ICD-9 for historical information.

Name: USCoreDischargeDisposition
Title: US Core Discharge Disposition
Descriptino: [National Uniform Billing Committee](http://www.nubc.org/), manual UB-04, UB form locator 17.

Name: USCoreEncounterType
Title: US Core Encounter Type
Descriptino: The type of encounter: a specific code indicating type of service provided. This value set includes codes from SNOMED CT decending from the concept 308335008 (Patient encounter procedure (procedure)) and codes from the Current Procedure and Terminology (CPT) found in the following CPT sections: - 99201-99499 E/M - 99500-99600 home health (mainly nonphysician, such as newborn care in home) - 99605-99607 medication management - 98966-98968 non physician telephone services (subscription to AMA Required)

Name: USCoreLaboratoryTestCodes
Title: US Core Laboratory Test Codes
Descriptino: Laboratory LOINC codes: From the introduction to August 2022 LOINC Users' guide; "The current scope of the existing laboratory portion of the LOINC  database includes all observations reported by clinical laboratories, including the specialty areas: chemistry, including therapeutic drug monitoring and toxicology; hematology; serology; blood bank; microbiology; cytology; surgical pathology; and fertility.

Name: USCoreProcedureCodes
Title: US Core Procedure Codes
Descriptino: Concepts from CPT, SNOMED CT, HCPCS Level II Alphanumeric Codes, ICD-10-PCS,CDT and LOINC code systems that can be used to indicate the type of procedure performed.

Name: UspsTwoLetterAlphabeticCodes
Title: USPS Two Letter Alphabetic Codes
Descriptino: This value set defines two letter USPS alphabetic codes.

Name: Hl7VSReAdmissionIndicator
Title: hl7VS-re-admissionIndicator
Descriptino: Value Set of codes which are used to specify that a patient is being re-admitted to a healthcare facility from which they were discharged, and indicates the circumstances around such re-admission.

Name: Hl7VSBedStatus
Title: hl7VS-bedStatus
Descriptino: Value Set of codes that specify the state of a bed in an inpatient setting, and is used to determine if a patient may be assigned to it or not.

Name: ActEncounterCode
Title: ActEncounterCode
Descriptino: Domain provides codes that qualify the ActEncounterClass (ENC)

Name: ActPriority
Title: ActPriority
Descriptino: A code or set of codes (e.g., for routine, emergency,) specifying the urgency under which the Act happened, can happen, is happening, is intended to happen, or is requested/demanded to happen.    *Discussion:* This attribute is used in orders to indicate the ordered priority, and in event documentation it indicates the actual priority used to perform the act. In definition mood it indicates the available priorities.

Name: ActSubstanceAdminSubstitutionCode
Title: ActSubstanceAdminSubstitutionCode
Descriptino: ***No description***

Name: ServiceDeliveryLocationRoleType
Title: ServiceDeliveryLocationRoleType
Descriptino: A role of a place that further classifies the setting (e.g., accident site, road side, work site, community location) in which services are delivered.

Name: SubstanceAdminSubstitutionReason
Title: SubstanceAdminSubstitutionReason
Descriptino: ***No description***
